title: Intentions for the Week
description: Intentions for the Week- Week 24 in 2025 Hi hiiiiii! Welcome to week 24! How was your weekend? Did you have any time to yourself? (I did! YAY!) Did you get to rest? (I could have used more sleep) Did you do meal prep? (I cleaned out the fridge!) Do you know whatâ€™s for dinner tonight? How about sriracha mac & cheese? Need to check in with yourself and regroup to finish the second half of 2025 with intention? Come to my workshop Saturday 06/28. Weâ€™ll check in together. Iâ€™ll show you all of my tracking tools (including my Time Management system and my Meal Planning Pack!) Half-Year Reset Workshop! 20% off for paid Substack subscribers (check our chat for code!) Here are my Intentions for the Week: Intentions this Week This weekâ€™s intentions: Mind/Body morning pages/ morning routine 30 minutes no screen after wakeup fill out my Intentions for the week calendar keep track of what I eat in my food journal keep track of movement on Apple watch move body daily- break a sweat breath work work in Currently workbook check-in with calendar art time floss daily horoscope connect with my spirit work in my hobonichi cousin outdoor time/hike? pull cards/journal/video watch how much time I spend on the phone tweeze things paint nails do a hair treatment clean house + phone a friend use my diffuser eating meeting steam facial take vitamins stay hydrated read before bed quality time with my cats get enough sleep Work: intentions for the week i love lists record stuff my everyday life tracyâ€™s tracking tools post recipe binder class stuff SELF Check In! upload/edit photos recipe testing work on Currently Workbook work on summer bucket list work on picnic essentials work on THC clean up office package/ship orders for The Handwriting Club (THANK YOU!) catch up pinning on my Pinterest account Tailwind catch up on social media clean up workspace bookkeeping/pay bills emails go to P.O. excerpt: Intentions for the Week is a weekly TO DO list series on Shutterbean.com, created by Tracy Benjamin of The Handwriting Club. What started as a personal planning ritual turned into a structured planner designed to help you organize your week with intention, creativity, and accountability. Follow along every Monday for inspiration, productivity tips, and a space to map out your goals!
